DOC.brief_summary: A Phase III study determine sensitivity specificity three solution different allergen extract diagnosis skin prick-test : - 5 Grasses pollen , - Birch pollen , - Dermatophagoides pteronyssinus mite
DOC.brief_title: Sensitivity Specificity 3 Solutions Allergen Extract Diagnosis Skin Prick Testing
DOC.criteria: Written inform consent participate study Male female subject age 560 year inclusive Female childbearing potential must reliable method contraception negative urine pregnancy test Presence clinical history allergy : seasonal perennial rhinitis , conjunctivitis and/or asthma grass birch pollen season ( least two pollen season ) and/or due mite exposure ( least two year ) Subjects affiliate social security system Pregnant breastfeed woman Dermographism Absence cutaneous reactivity Presence cutaneous lesion forearm either prevent performance test potentially interfering interpretation test Subjects present unstable asthma poor general health condition Subjects past current specific immunotherapy treatment 3 test allergen ( Grass , Birch pollens , D. pteronyssinus and/or D. farinae mite ) previous 5 year Any oral antihistaminic treatment previous 3 day 10 day case loratadine desloratadine Subjects antiIgE treatment Subjects treat betablockers and/or antidepressives . Subjects currently participate another clinical trial still exclusion period previous clinical trial Investigators , coinvestigators , well child spouse study collaborator Subjects protection court , legal guardianship legal trusteeship
